recipe.preparation: Pound chicken breasts to 3/8" and lightly salt and pepper.  Coat chicken with mustard and allow to set for 10 minutes.  In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 2 1/2 tbsp butter and quickly brown chicken.  Transfer chicken to baking dish and bake at 10 minutes at 350F until chicken is done.Melt 1 tbsp butter in a skillet over medium heat.  Saute garlic until softened and add stock.  Simmer until broth is reduced by half.Cook pasta and drain.  Melt 1 1/2 tbsp butter in pot and add pasta, 1 1/2 tbsp parsley and basil.  Remove from heat and cover to keep warm.Add cream, remaining parsley, salt and pepper to reduced chicken stock.  Reduce at a simmer until sauce thickens to a light gravy consistency.Plate pasta and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.  Top with chicken and smother with sauce.
recipe.name: Garlic Chicken
recipe.notes: Labeled by my mother as "Absolutely Fantastic!!"
